Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
Value.Help: Flush dimmer module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system. Default value 255.

Item.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

Value.label: Automatic turning off output after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto OFF disabled. 1 second to 32536 seconds Auto OFF enabled with defined time, step is 1 second. Default value 0.

Value.label: Automatic turning on output after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto ON disabled. 1 second to 32535 seconds Auto ON enabled with defined time, step is 1 second. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable/Disable 3-way switch/additional switch
Value.Help: Dimming is done by push button or switch connected to I1 (by default). Enabling 3-way switch, dimming can be controlled by push button or switch connected to I1 and I2. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable/Disable Double click function
Value.Help: If Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push button will set dimming power at maximum dimming value. Default value 0.

Value.label: Saving the state of the relay after a power failure

Item.label: Flush dimmer module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
Flush dimmer module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to off position

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0% - 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 5.

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
Value.Help: Set value means time interval (0 - 32767) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 second to 32767 seconds reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s).

Value.label: Minimum dimming value
Value.Help: 1 - 98 = 1% - 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 1 (Minimum dimming value is 1%).

Value.label: Maximum dimming value
Value.Help: 2 - 99 = 2% - 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 99 (Maximum dimming value is 99%).

Value.label: Dimming time (soft on/off)
Value.Help: Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I1 or controlled through. 1- 255 = 10mseconds - 2550mseconds (2,55s), step is 10mseconds. Default value 100 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 1s).

Value.label: Dimming time when key pressed
Value.Help: Time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max dimming values by continues hold of push button I1. 1- 255 = 1 second - 255 seconds. Default value 3 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 3s).

Value.label: Ignore start level
Value.Help: This parameter is used with association group 4. A receiving device SHOULD respect the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 0. A receiving device MUST ignore the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 1. Default value 0.

Value.label: Dimming duration
Value.Help: This parameter is used with association group 3. The Duration field MUST specify the time that the transition should take from the current value to the new target value. A supporting device SHOULD respect the specified Duration value. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I2 or select Notification Type and Event
Value.Help: Enabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Endpoint device type selection: notification sensor (1 - 6) sensor binary (9). NOTE: After parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect! Default value 1.

Item.label: Home Security; Motion Detection, unknown location.
Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown location.
Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown location

Value.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I3 or select Notification Type and Event
Value.Help: Enabling I3 means that Endpoint (I3) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Endpoint device type selection: notification sensor (1 - 6) sensor binary (9). NOTE: After parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect! Default value 1.

Item.label: Home Security; Motion Detection, unknown location.
Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown location.
Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown location

Value.label: Temperature sensor offset settings
Value.Help: Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor. 32536 : offset is 0.0C. From 1 to 100 : value from 0.1 C to 10.0 C is added to actual measured temperature. From 1001 to 1100 : value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature. Default value 32536.

Value.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
Value.Help: If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. 0 : Reporting disabled. 1- 127 = 0,1C - 12,7C, step is 0,1C. Default value 5 = 0,5C change.

Group.label: Start level change/stop level change input I1
